instructions.name: cancel_offer
docs: if incase, it's completed shouldn't be able to call this

accounts.name: maker
docs: Must match the maker stored in the offer

accounts.name: offer
docs: The offer PDA that serves dual purpose as:
2. Authority over the vault token account
- Must be signed by original maker
- Will be closed with rent returned to maker

accounts.name: whitelist
docs: The whitelist PDA storing allowed takers
Will be closed and rent returned to maker

accounts.name: maker_token_account
docs: Token account owned by maker that will receive
- Must match input token mint from offer

accounts.name: vault_token_account
docs: The vault token account holding the offered tokens
Created as an Associated Token Account owned by offer PDA
Will be closed after returning tokens
- Must have offer PDA as authority

accounts.name: admin_config
docs: Admin configuration PDA for updating protocol statistics

accounts.name: input_token_mint
docs: The mint of the token being returned

accounts.name: token_program
docs: Token interface program for Token-2022 support

accounts.name: offer
docs: The offer PDA storing all trade details

accounts.name: admin_config
docs: Admin configuration for protocol verification and statistics
Must be initialized before any offers can be created

accounts.name: fee_config
docs: Fee configuration providing protocol fee parameters
Must be initialized before any offers can be created

accounts.name: maker_token_account
docs: Maker's token account containing tokens to be offered
Must match the input token mint

accounts.name: vault_token_account
docs: Vault token account created as an Associated Token Account
Will hold the offered tokens until trade completion

accounts.name: token_program
docs: Token interface program for Token-2022 support

accounts.name: admin
docs: The admin account that will control protocol settings

accounts.name: admin_config
docs: PDA storing admin details and protocol statistics

accounts.name: system_program
docs: Global PDA for tracking maker sequences

accounts.name: maker
docs: Original offer maker, must sign whitelist operations

accounts.name: whitelist
docs: The whitelist PDA storing allowed takers
Created on first use with init_if_needed
Space for up to 50 taker addresses

accounts.name: offer
docs: The offer this whitelist belongs to

accounts.name: taker
docs: Transaction signer who will take the offer.

accounts.name: offer
docs: - Closed on completion with rent returned to maker

accounts.name: maker_receive_token_account
docs: Maker's token account for receiving payment.
Automatically created as an ATA if it doesn't exist.

accounts.name: taker_payment_token_account
docs: Taker's token account for sending payment.
Automatically created as an ATA if it doesn't exist.

accounts.name: taker_receive_token_account
docs: Taker's token account for receiving offered tokens.
Automatically created as an ATA if it doesn't exist.

accounts.name: vault_token_account
docs: - Must be owned by offer PDA

accounts.name: input_token_mint
docs: Mint of the token being offered

accounts.name: output_token_mint
docs: Mint of the token being requested

errors.name: TooManyMints
errors.msg: Maximum number of whitelisted mints reached

errors.name: FeeConfigNotInitialized
errors.msg: Fee configuration has not been initialized

errors.name: InvalidDeadline
errors.msg: Deadline must be in the future

errors.name: InvalidAmount
errors.msg: Token amount must be greater than 0

types.name: AdminConfig
docs: Configuration account for admin operations and offer tracking

types.name: FeeConfig
docs: Account structure storing fee configuration for the protocol
Controls both the fee amount and where fees are sent

fields.name: fee_percentage
docs: The fee amount in basis points (1/100th of a percent)

fields.name: fee_address
docs: The public key of the account that receives protocol fees
All fees collected from trades will be sent to this address

types.name: MintWhitelist
docs: Account structure storing the whitelist of permitted token mints
This controls which tokens can be used in the protocol

fields.name: mints
docs: Vector of public keys representing allowed token mints
Only tokens from these mints can be used in the protocol when whitelist is enabled

types.name: Offer
docs: Account structure representing a token swap offer
Stores all details about an offer including its current state and parameters

fields.name: maker
docs: The public key of the account that created this offer
Controls permissions for offer modification and cancellation

fields.name: input_token_mint
docs: The mint address of the token being offered
Must be a whitelisted token mint if whitelist is enabled

fields.name: token_amount
docs: The amount of tokens being offered
Decreases as partial fills occur, reaches 0 when fully filled

fields.name: output_token_mint
docs: The mint address of the token being offered
Must be a whitelisted token mint if whitelist is enabled

fields.name: expected_total_amount
docs: The total amount of payment tokens expected in return
Used to calculate the exchange rate for partial fills

fields.name: token_amount_remaining
docs: token amount_a remaining after each trade

fields.name: deadline
docs: Unix timestamp when this offer expires
Offer cannot be taken after this time

types.name: OfferStatus
docs: Enum representing the possible states of an offer
Used to track the offer's lifecycle and control permitted operations

types.name: Whitelist
docs: Account structure representing a whitelist of allowed takers for a specific offer
Controls which addresses can take (accept) a particular offer

fields.name: offer
docs: The public key of the offer this whitelist is associated with
Links the whitelist to its specific offer

fields.name: takers
docs: Vector of public keys representing addresses allowed to take the offer
Only these addresses can execute trades against the offer when whitelist is enabled
Empty vector means no takers are currently whitelisted

types.name: WhitelistConfig
docs: Account structure controlling whether token mint whitelist is enforced
Provides global toggle for whitelist functionality

fields.name: require_whitelist
docs: Boolean flag indicating if whitelist checking is required
true = only whitelisted token mints can be used
false = any token mint can be used
